They typically participate at the Pre-Seed, Seed, or Pre-Series A stages and prefer companies capable of rapid growth through natural demand within large or growing Total Addressable Markets (TAMs). BlueLotus Ventures provides more than just capital; they actively work with investee companies, offering guidance on product development, marketing, customer acquisition, and building intellectual property portfolios. Their portfolio companies have collectively raised over $400 million in follow-on funding from notable investors, and their 2018 investment cohort has achieved a Total Value to Paid-in Capital (TVPI) of 41x.

By doing so, Chakra aims to bring about fundamental efficiencies in scaling deployments, ultimately enabling industries to become carbon neutral. column11:
FinSight Ventures emphasizes partnering with visionary entrepreneurs as a long-term collaborator, aligning with founders to drive sustainable growth. The firm's approach is built on three core principles:​

Ownership Mindset: Investing at least 30% of their own capital ensures deep alignment with management teams, free from external pressures.​

Founder Partnership: Collaborating with founders to scale businesses by leveraging a global network, operational expertise, and cross-border insights.​

Flexibility and Discipline: Deploying investments up to $50 million with flexibility in check size, instrument, and investment horizon, focusing on long-term opportunities where meaningful, lasting impact can be achieved.​

The firm seeks to institutionalize seed investments in India by focusing on consumer tech, SaaS, and tech-enabled businesses with strong network effects. Gemba Capital prioritizes startups tapping into the immense potential of mid to lower-income households in India and SaaS companies capable of creating exceptional products for global markets. They adopt a hands-on approach, actively supporting founders who are brave problem solvers, and work closely with them to provide valuable expertise and guidance throughout their entrepreneurial journey.

Golden Sparrow also places a strong emphasis on diversity, with one-third of its fund held by women investors, and is committed to sustainability, dedicating at least two investments toward carbon-reducing startups. ​

They are sector-agnostic within the B2B domain, with particular interest in areas such as semiconductors, defense technology, space technology, alternative materials, and advanced manufacturing.

The firm collaborates with institutional investors, corporates, and academic institutions to create a supportive ecosystem for its portfolio companies.

column7: Sector Agnostic, AgriTech, FMCG
column11: Zephyr Peacock India aims to support emerging enterprises in India by providing growth capital and management support. The firm invests in businesses with the potential to become market leaders in one of the fastest-growing economies globally, actively assisting them in implementing their growth strategies.
